name: Intelli#
tagline: Plugins for C# & .NET development in IntelliJ IDEA
body:
# IntelliSharp
IntelliSharp is a bundle of plugins for [IntelliJ IDEA (Community + Ultimate Edition)](https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community), which together enable C# & .NET development inside IntelliJ IDEA.

# Origins
This project is a backport of the [Consulo IDE](https://github.com/consulo/consulo) ‒ a fork of [IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition](https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community) with support for C# and .NET development ‒ to the main IntelliJ IDEA platform.

All credit for the features taken from Consulo goes to its original author(s); see the commit history for more information on who contributed which feature.
The sources from Consulo are used under the [Apache License, Version 2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0).

## Why not just use Consulo?
The short answer is: To have unlimited access to the rich set of other plugins that are available for the IntelliJ IDEA platform.
Although the [github.com/consulo](https://github.com/consulo) contains forks of many common IntelliJ Plugins, these are necessarily out-of-date with respect to their upstream counterparts.

Also, by preventing the use of the Consulo plugins in the official IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition, the size of the user base ‒ and thus the number of possible contributors ‒ is unnecessarily limited.
The aim of IntelliSharp project is to make the plugins available to a wider audience.

# Contributing
Contributions are welcome!
See the main [Intelli# Home](https://github.com/intellisharp/intellisharp-home) repository on GitHub for more information.

This website is itself open-sourced and available at [github.com/intellisharp/intellisharp.github.io](https://github.com/intellisharp/intellisharp.github.io).

# License
Source code, documentation and website are licensed under the [**Apache License, Version 2.0**](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0).
